figure 1 shows the curve c1 which has polar equation r = a(3 + 2cosθ), 0 - θ < 2π, and 
the circle c2 with equation r = 4a, 0 - θ < 2π,  where a is a positive constant.
 
(a) find, in terms of a, the polar coordinates of the points where the curve c1 meets the 
circle c2.
(4)
 
the regions enclosed by the curves c1 and c2 overlap and this common region r is shaded 
in the figure.
 
(b) find, in terms of a, an exact expression for the area of the shaded region r.
(8)

polar equation r = 2a cos θ, 0 - θ < 2π.  show clearly the coordinates of the points of 
intersection of c1, c2 and c3 with the initial line, θ = 0.
